reviews.review_msg: Scott is one of the best profs I have had at Beedie. He was so caring and would really provide opportunities for students to excel. The videos he records must have taken him so much time and he had such a professional set up for online classes I really respected him. He had a kid during the term and was still able to be accessible. Highly recommend

I took both BUS 254 and 251 with Scott and he is by far the best prof at SFU, I don't necessarily have an interest in accounting but watching his pre-recorded lectures are informative and enjoyable. Exams are a time crunch however they are fair I understand all accounting exams are like that regardless of the prof. Very caring and accessible.

I never write reviews but Raymond is so unimaginably inadequate, you must be warned before taking any class with him. he takes 254, an otherwise easy class, distorts it and makes everything seem more complicated than it is. The book gives clearer methods, yet he will profusely argue his incorrect answers despite the answer key proving him wrong.

Raymond seems very knowledgeable and passionate about accounting, however he is not a great teacher.  It is very difficult to stay focused during lectures and his explanations in tutorial are lengthy and often very confusing.

This prof is so baffling. I have never met such an inadequate teacher in my life. He will go out of his way to disagree with the answer key in the textbook. There was one question where the entire class argued with him because he disagreed with the right answer. His exams have nothing to do with his homework. He contradicts himself a lot.

Ray is a genuinely nice prof and he is willing to listen to feedback. He is also a lenient marker. However, he can be very disorganized and doesn't explain concepts clearly. The midterm and final were extremely fair and there are a lot of assignments, but they ultimately help you improve your understanding.

The course content isnt very hard and hes very good at giving similar types of questions on practice exams as they would be on the tests. teaching isnt anything special its pretty average but he genuinely cares for his students and tried his best to make this a good experience for his students.
Lectures were enjoyable. Midterm was reasonable
Absolute gem. Funny and better than other dry accounting profs

This is a really sarcastic prof, who uses quite a bit of dry humour. I don't think he teaches anything special, but he makes the lectures quite enjoyable. lmao, he even uses the basic ass slides from wiley plus, or his ubc slides when he taught managerial accounting at ubc. Simply put, he makes learning the material enjoyable in class.

Safia explained concepts very well and included in-class participation to keep the class engaged during lecture. Her exams are very fair and only tested the main concepts taught in the course. The homework she assigns is useful to help understand concepts taught in lecture, and serves as great practice when preparing for exams.

Safia is really nice and gives super fair exams; nothing that you didn't learn. Her voice is very calming and she tries to engage the class with participation questions that aren't for marks so you can practice. I found the course itself to be very difficult and will require lots of practice beyond homework to do well.
Safia is very fair in her exams and grading. She does not expect you to memorize everything, just key concepts. She gives great practice questions that prepare you very well for quizzes and exams.
Safia is great professor. It was very nice to have someone with real life experience teach accounting. I don't plan on being an accountant but Safia made the course material interesting and fun!

Great prof with actual experience in the field. Does a great job of explaining concepts with real life examples that he has been through. Notes are simple and to the point. Tests are very fair and simple if you do the textbook assignments. Grade is based on tutorial, midterm, and final which makes tutorial very important, I learned the hard way.
Awesome prof! Really experienced so he's great at explaining and giving examples. Focus in class and then read through textbook! Test heavy so don't cram, you need to study well in advance.

One of the easiest courses to follow as there it only lectured which follow the book step by step, and tutorials on pre-done exercises - amen! However, it is a quantitative course and you need to get your head around it. Marco is great; clear, precise, motivating, and humble. You won't regret the course even if you aren't a numerical person.
Marco is a really good prof. His exams are fair but since it is a quantitative course doing the homework questions for tutorials and understanding the concepts is fundamental.
Great Prof!
Awful experience all round.  Very difficult to understand. Apparently she's done at SFU and moving on to another school! A blessing for sure!!
Do not take this course with Tanya Tang. You will regret it.  If you like equations then I guess she is for you, if you are into theory, take it with Kamlani.  Period.

Very hard to understand at first, but once your able to translate what she is saying, its not so bad.  Reads straight from slides, but still have to go to class for pop quizzes. Overall, it's a challenging course, doesn't matter who the prof is.  Tanya, although difficult to understand, is very nice and does try her best to help students learn.

She is a terrible professor. Has no clue how to teach and makes no attempt to better herself. Her sample midterms are not remotely close to the exams. It is purely a self taught class, because she relies on the manuf. powerpoint throughout the class, and has nothing to add!
I thought she was good. I love Lyryx! Totally helped me. This class just seemed to make sense!

most horrible teacher ever, someone who cant speak english should not be teaching at a university where we speak english.  you need a translator to understand what she says.  she struggles over words and its like she doesnt understand her powerpoints. some pointers: when she says "causes" its really cost.and we use costs a lot

Wow she is the worst teacher on earth. As mentioned before she cannot speaky english. Wow and another thing she is freaking annoying. I hate when she tries to pronounce words such as labour. She practically reads off the slides and expects us to do well. I think she is a bit crazy too. She is unreasonable and is sad to look at and sad to listentoo
He is a great prof! Sometimes he can go off topic but otherwise really good as he is approachable and willing to answer questions.

When I took BUS254 in summer 08 it was Mary's first time teaching. For a first timer, I thought she was pretty good. Midterm was fairly easy--the average was 75%. The final however was more on the challenging side.

Mary is an awesome professor. She made the course easy to understand. Her midterms and the final are fair. Make sure you do the tutorial questions and understand them! I'd definately take another class with her!

Excellent professor.  Her notes are very useful and clear. She communicates her materials very fluently.   However, her exams are hard and time consuming, especially the final. Overall, she is a great accounting professor. I would rate her 4.5/5.

Her lectures are very clear and straightforward. The lecture notes are useful and clear in every sense and somehow u dun even needa read the textbook if u pay attention in class. The midterm is easy but the final is a bit challenging. But overall as an accounting prof, she explains everything clearly n makes everything easy and simply. Recommended!

Was very rude and inefficient during the midterm. Assigns useless homework. Exams were nothing like the homework or tutorial problems. Tutorials were rushed and not helpful. Often left lectures feeling confused. Learned more with 2 hours of YouTube videos than I did a whole semester of lectures. No support/guide for exams.

Course was horribly mismanaged by this professor. His lectures were fine and he explained topics relatively clearly but antisocial TAs had no idea what they were doing during tutorials. They would give 90 minutes worth of questions to do in 30 minutes. Prof took midterm wayy too seriously, spent exam time preparing room and gave no extra time.
Terrible teaching style. Goes through lectures quickly with no explanation. No practice sheet given out to prepare for midterm. No help what so ever.

Professor gives little to no explanation on course topics and expects students to understand lectures while zooming through nearly 100 lecture slides per class. Midterm/Final was nothing like the homework he assigns through WILEY, and provides no means of study material for exams or any feedback on assignments done through homework or tutorial.

This guy makes SFU look bad. He has such a huge ego and the fact that he is allowed to have responsibility over student's grades should be criminal given how little he cares for them, and once again weakens the schools reputation.

Worst prof I have ever met. He does not seem to care about his students, even if they reached out to him. He does not seem to want his students to succeed. You're better off taking a course with another prof.
WHAT A WASTE OF TIME!! PLEASE DON'T TAKE IT FROM HIM
Don't take his class!!! He is so bad! I don't understand how he is still allowed to teach!

AVOID!!! The worst prof I've ever had. At first, he seems like a nice person but that's not how he actually is. He thinks that everyone is cheating because they did better on the final exam than the midterm. It's my first time posting a review here because everyone should know how bad he is. Taking BUS 254 with him was the biggest mistake I made.

He is USELESS!! AVOID THIS PROF AT ALL COSTS. Looking for a professor that drastically lowers your GPA? Micheal is your man :) I would rather take all the courses at SFU simultaneously than taking any course with this professor individually. NOTE: If you read any positive reviews about him don't believe it. He would have written it himself.
Horrible. Don't take. Save yourself.

Worst prof I have ever had at SFU, I have never felt so disrespected. Homework was absurdly difficult at times and he is difficult to talk to. Exams killed me he does not post his slides. Avoid at all costs!!!
Seems like a nice guy at first but really does not care about his students at all. He makes his own rules that may not be even apart of university policy.

Very unorganized with everything. Lecture slides posted on Canvas don't match the ones used in class and he refused to post them. Talks fast and lectures are hard to follow. For exams I just studied the textbook and redo the hw questions.
shouldnt have got hired
lectures and tuturials were uncoordinated
Midterm and final was unfair. Way too much homework

This was the worst prof I have ever had. Unclear in lectures, horrible at teaching, gave an absolutely absurd amount of homework that was worth a lot. Ive been at sfu for 3 years, this is the first prof Ive ever rated because it just had to be known how unbelievably bad he was. I tried to rate him a 0/5 but couldnt.
literally his lectures and his homework qn/ tutorials are completely off...

Michael's class had such a large disconnect between lecture material, homework questions, and tutorial work that it was almost impossible to grasp key concepts. What makes matters worse is that the in-class slides and the tutorial work could not be viewed after said class/tutorials and so if your note-taking isn't up to par, you're done for.

Online homework was pretty frustrating - if you got one part wrong you could lose 1/3 of the points. Not sure how people did well on hw. Lectures were decent, short and as interesting as accounting can be. Tutorials were useful and well organized. Only one hard question on the midterm the rests of the tests weren't too bad. Overall a decent class.
Very enthusiastic, makes the class fun. Passionate about the subject and very knowledgeable.
dry sense of humour, refuses to provide answers for textbook questions, blunt and rude. Probably one of the most difficult classes I've taken.

Lectures were useless, basically just read off the slides the whole time, which came straight out of the textbook. He did go through some practice problems as examples but he goes so fast there's no way to know what's going on. Beware the midterm.

HARDEST PROF AT SFU!! hands down, 3rd year student who kept delaying 254 cuz this guy was always teaching it... Youre gonna fail the midterm.. Final is more fair but extremely tough. Take 254 with a better prof in summer. Don't take this advice and youll get a C...

Michael is an all around really great person, he has a quirky sense of humour and is there for students when needed. However,  to do well in this course you really need to put the time in, homework is difficult and seeing the T.A's to understand it is essential. Midterm and final were relatively tough so do all of the homework and lecture Q's.

His exams are tough but if you practice and understand the concepts you will do fine.  Attendance to tutorial is mandatory and you are required to do a presentation on homework assignment.  He is very friendly and helpful in his office hours and it is clear he wants to help you succeed.  If you are confused on anything go to his office hours.

Meh. Not that great, not the worst though. His lecture slides could be a lot better, but at least he gets all the concepts across decently enough. Make sure you do all the homework assignments, or else you'll definitely fall behind.
Prof is terrible, final exam doesn't explain material well at all. His powerpoint notes are terrible. Avoid Him!
Easily my favorite Beedie prof. He's direct, clear and super funny! Definitely takes the dryness out of accounting

I absolutely love this guy!! His blunt sense of humour is fantastic and it keeps the class interesting. I had a low interest on accounting and to be honest was a little nervous at the beginning of the semester. The txtbook he wrote is really useful in understnding the topics. As long as you keep up with readings and doing the questions you'll be ok

This prof is not helpful. His lectures are not very organized and he doesnt explain the material very well. He goes through some problems in class but does not really explain it.. He just does it on the overhead. I would avoid his lectures if possible
Great Prof. Exams are much easier than the weekly questions, so if you keep up with those you'll be fine. Interesting guy too, he knows his stuff
I don't do RMP comments, but his marking style was so bad... that i had to do it...
Really nice prof! Midterms and finals are not  that hard as his book's excercises. His joke about ROI is funny! Love him!
He has a really nice personality, and the book is pretty straight forward. His exams don't look like any of the practice questions, but they still made sense.

ok so on the final and MT he decides to throw in q's we've nvr seen in class or assgmts, totally unfair!! he was apparently writing a book so the lectures in class were not the same as what he posted online due to copyright issues, gimme a break. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST!!!

Great guy, quite funny, which keeps lectures interesting. Clear explanations, just like the textbook he wrote. Like all other business profs, he shows u clearly the percentage of the class that gets a certain grade, don't know how weird that can be.

He has a good sense of humor, which sometimes keeps me awake. Yes, accounting is so boring. It isn't hard, as long as you read textbook, you'll survive. His marking policy is very strange. I should have a A+ though.
boring lecturer, came off as a little arrogant, went through concepts too quickly, didn't learn anything from him - had to learn it all from textbook myself :(

ridiculous. 60 something ppl got Cs. that's right, not C+. only a few ppl got b- and a- or b+. weirdest curve EVER. i got 4% above average as my final grade and i still got a C. how the hell does that work?!

Lectures aren't mandatory but they help to understand the material. Lots of work! There are weekly assignments for tutorial as well as online assignments that can take a long time. Midterm was brutal! But for some reason the final exam was MUCH easier. The curve is a little ridiculous, it gave way too many students Bs and not enough B+ or A-
in an accounting class over 180 students, he only gave less than 4 students A+'s after the class is curved. That's too mean!

Used his own PPT notes from a book he penned that will be published in Fall. Since they were "copyrighted by the publisher," he could not send them to us. This was particularly unhelpful. Not a hard course really, but lecture style made topics dry and boring. Attendance not really mandatory, just read the book. Mcdonald did a far better job in 251!

This class is HARD and this guy makes it even harder for some students. His midterm was a KILLER. like omg, the average was 52%, but his final was easy. overall, he is good at explaining concepts but  he is just wayyy too hard. he doesnt even have lecture slides for you because he is making his own book or something. well, BS, thats complete garbag

Worst Professor I have ever had in three years.  No notes, not helpful and is a complete jerk when you ask him for help. The average for midterm was 52%.  Makes you write in pen for accounting!.  Honestly the worst professor I have ever had

Friendly enough but the amount of content covered is too much and the amount of work weekly is way too much. No Powerpoint posted because he's writing a book but the ones he uses are useless. He flips between them so fast, you can't follow anyways.

Worst Accounting Professor and maybe professor Ive ever had! Tests were unfair ( tested us and material not lectured upon or in text) NO NOTES because he is making his own book therefore can't print out his notes or use the text and goes through slides to fast to let you copy anything down.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS GPA KILLER and HORRIBLE PROFESSOR
Good Prof. Taught well and was very thorough. Ensure you study hard though, becasuse it's not an easy course.
The final was tricky.  The powerpoint notes are the official ones from the textbook, but would wish they were shorter.
This prof is a moron. Yes his lectures may be interesting but it doesn't do crap on the exams. The course is interesting but the prof made the course crap. I think this prof should be fired.

I think he got mad because people left class before it ends. The reason? cuz he was doing some stupid demonstration problems after the lecture. There is no break in his lecture, and if you go to see him personally and asks some questions, he would repeat things in your text. It was not a bad course but he made it bad. Final was crazy brutal.

Another example of a nice guy who can't teach worth crap. After the midterm, for some reason, he wouldn't let TAs answer questions on WebCt, his lectures are repeating poewrpoint slides, and he spammed the hell out of my inbox. Don't evenstudy for the final, you'll fail anyway, it's based on time management, not knowledge.

haha notice how the ratings changed from 3 and 4s to all 1s after this final..haha hilarious. i dont know if he's doing it out of revenge or was his exams always this hard. he was like the nicest guy ever but the more i get to know him the more of a d*** he becomes. i guess after we filled out the evaluations he turned the tables on us.pretty slick

He may sound clear during lectures, and make everything seem so easy, until the final exam comes. The final exam was the worst, hardest, trickest, and longest final exam ever, after my three years at SFU.

He disliked teaching this course and it showed after the midterm.  It was almost like he deter people from accounting.  Definately take this course with another prof, even though apparently he's never teaching a 200 level course again.
He is very experienced and it shows when he gives examples in lectures. He makes lectures interesting ... and his exams are fair.
Great Prof, great learning, study hard!
great prof, i enjoyed being in his class. really knows the subject and enjoys teaching it. always available for extra help! exams are a little hard but fair
class was so boring, and his powerpoint notes are not much help either. Everyone does well so it all depends on final, which by the way was brutal!

VERY boring class, though helpful--lots of interaction on WebCT. Midterm was easy, final was harder. He should release distributions--nothing worse than not knowing where u are in a curved course when u thought the exams were super easy. Seriously if you can do arithmetic, u will pwn this boring course. And ignore his nonsense about the appendices

He is a good individual(helpful) If you're interested in accounting/business, youll find course useful and easy but for others it will be very confusing. ppl tend to do well in this class (summer semstr average was in 70-80s!) i am glad it is over even though he is a nice guy
His teaches very clearly, but the problem is everyone is good at this course.  Therefore, it is still hard to get high marks.
He is nice and has interesting view. He is a good prof.

He breezes through the Powerpoints so you can't take notes, and he won't post them neither.  There are old pwrpnts but they're a bit different than the one's he's using.  Examples he goes through in class really easy, Exam questions really difficult..
Great prof and great class!
His teaching ability is a kind of weak because he just read what it's on the lecture notes. But his exams are not bad, quite straight foward. Hope he can be friendly in next semester.
Cool accent, but that's the only thing good about this guy. I really hated the course and breathed a huge sigh of relief when it was over. HARD exams!
Funny, nice guy, but not that great of the teacher.  Cool accent.
terrible communicator
One of the worst profs ever!  He regurgitates what the textbook said and he is not helpful at all.  Avoid him if you can!
His lecture is fun and easy to understand but the content itself is very hard.  You need to do all the questions in the exercise book if you want a good mark.
No Comments
This prof doesn't answer any question, and doesn't allow TA to answer hw questions too.
No Comments
No Comments
